law.catch_line: Surcharge On Division Of Occupational Safety Fees
law.text: [ Text of section effective until March 27, 2011. For text effective March 27, 2011, see below.] There shall be a surcharge on fees assessed by the division of occupational safety within the department of economic security for the licensure, registration or certification of certain professionals, and on fees assessed for the renewal or duplication of such licenses, registrations or certifications, in accordance with the provisions of this section. The amount of the surcharge shall be as follows: a $25 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified individually by the division of occupational safety to perform deleading services; a $25 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified individually by the division of occupational safety to perform asbestos abatement services; a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified on behalf of corporate and other classifications of businesses by the division of occupational safety to perform deleading services; a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified on behalf of corporate and other classifications of businesses by the division of occupational safety to perform asbestos abatement services; a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified by the division of occupational safety to provide asbestos abatement analytical services; a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified by the division of occupational safety to provide asbestos abatement training; a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified by the division of occupational safety to provide deleading training; and a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or registered to operate an employment agency as defined by section 46A of chapter 140. Said surcharges shall be collected by the division of occupational safety and transmitted to the treasurer for deposit into the general fund. Chapter 23: Surcharge on fees assessed by department of labor standards [ Text of section as amended by 2011, 3, Secs. 21 and 22 effective March 27, 2011. For text effective until March 27, 2011, see above.] There shall be a surcharge on fees assessed by the department of labor standards for the licensure, registration or certification of certain professionals, and on fees assessed for the renewal or duplication of such licenses, registrations or certifications, in accordance with the provisions of this section. The amount of the surcharge shall be as follows: a $25 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified individually by the department of labor standards to perform deleading services; a $25 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified individually by the department of labor standards to perform asbestos abatement services; a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified on behalf of corporate and other classifications of businesses by the department of labor standards to perform deleading services; a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified on behalf of corporate and other classifications of businesses by the department of labor standards to perform asbestos abatement services; a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified by the department of labor standards to provide asbestos abatement analytical services; a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified by the department of labor standards to provide asbestos abatement training; a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or certified by the department of labor standards to provide deleading training; and a $50 annual surcharge to those persons licensed or registered to operate an employment agency as defined by section 46A of chapter 140. Said surcharges shall be collected by the department of labor standards and transmitted to the treasurer for deposit into the general fund.
